page.title: 08CORN EXCHANGE AND FIRE STN.
page.content: The Corn Exchange was built in the late nineteenth century on the site of the former jail.A bomb blew the statue off the pediment in World War 2.It was first used for concerts or readings.The building is stone with Corinthian pillars at the front. FIRE STATION. The Fire Station was built on the old London Road on the 14th of September 1963.The 28 men working there are split into 4 sections,red,white,green and blue.The Station is the County Fire Station.All fire calls go to the staff who have direct radio links to the 32 Stations around Hertfordshire. When an emergency call comes in,lights flash on a console which switches on a recorder.
